title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India, tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, eating places, pictures, experiences etc.

**Food and Recipes Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Food+and+Recipes+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=7b05ed23b7e6dff392ae637a98524e812dfb4791
comments:
Healthy Lunch (it can be personalized per your needs)

Step 1. Make a batch of khichdi that lasts 4 to 5 days and keep it in the fridge. I have a container that has lapsi, red rice, moong dal chilti, black channa, and remnants of nachni. I keep adding grains and pulses to this container on a whim so the khichdi mix is always eclectic. 

For daily lunch:

Slice a quarter of a cabbage finely. Slice half a bunch of spinach finely. Add an onion if you like. 

Saute all the above vegetables. Add a portion of khichdi to the vegetables. Stir well until the khichdi is warmed up. Add a pinch of salt. Break an egg into this mix and stir continuously until the egg is well mixed. Don't let the thing dry. Turn off the gas.

Slice 3 cloves of garlic and some coriander finely. Mix it into the food and stir well.
